description.raw:
This changes `ignition-math4-config.cmake` to define CMake variables with the project version in them (i.e. `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` becomes `IGNITION-MATH4_INCLUDE_DIRS`).

I ran into a problem including headers  from ignition-math in gazebo_experimental. I have `ign-math3` installed from a package, and am trying to build ignition-math from default branch. I think what's happening is gazebo_experimental calls `find_package(ignition-common0 QUIET)` first which calls `find_package(ignition-math3 REQUIRED)`. This sets sets the cmake variable `IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED`.  Later when gazebo_experimental calls `find_package(ignition-math4 QUIET)` the script sees `IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED` is set and exits.  `IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS` points to the ignition-math3 headers, and the build fails.
description.html:
This changes ignition-math4-config.cmake to define CMake variables with the project version in them (i.e. IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS becomes IGNITION-MATH4_INCLUDE_DIRS).

I ran into a problem including headers from ignition-math in gazebo_experimental. I have ign-math3 installed from a package, and am trying to build ignition-math from default branch. I think what's happening is gazebo_experimental calls find_package(ignition-common0 QUIET) first which calls find_package(ignition-math3 REQUIRED). This sets sets the cmake variable IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED. Later when gazebo_experimental calls find_package(ignition-math4 QUIET) the script sees IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED is set and exits. IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS points to the ignition-math3 headers, and the build fails.

title.raw: Make CMake variables use versioned project name

This changes ignition-math4-config.cmake to define CMake variables with the project version in them (i.e. IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS becomes IGNITION-MATH4_INCLUDE_DIRS).

I ran into a problem including headers from ignition-math in gazebo_experimental. I have ign-math3 installed from a package, and am trying to build ignition-math from default branch. I think what's happening is gazebo_experimental calls find_package(ignition-common0 QUIET) first which calls find_package(ignition-math3 REQUIRED). This sets sets the cmake variable IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED. Later when gazebo_experimental calls find_package(ignition-math4 QUIET) the script sees IGNITION-MATH_CONFIG_INCLUDED is set and exits. IGNITION-MATH_INCLUDE_DIRS points to the ignition-math3 headers, and the build fails.
